data.title: The Sustainable Development Goals Academy
data.meta_description: Find out how The Sustainable Development Goals Academy is tackling global issues to create a more sustainable and just future for everyone!
data.text:
What are the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)?

The UN 2030 agenda, with the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) at its core, is a guide to tackling the world’s most pressing challenges – including ending poverty and bringing economic prosperity, social inclusion, environmental sustainability and peace and good governance to all countries and all people by 2030.

The SDGs, adopted by 193 UN member states in 2015, are:

A guide to tackling the world’s most pressing challenges – including ending poverty and bringing economic prosperity, social inclusion, environmental sustainability and peace and good governance to all countries and all people by 2030

Pressure points that have the capability to affect the well-being of the entire planet and the people who live on it

An ambitious plan of action requiring the concerted efforts of all segments of society including civil society, development practitioners, the private sector, and academia

An ask to each one of us, in our personal capacities, to take bold and transformative steps which are urgently needed to shift the world onto a sustainable and resilient path

The SDGs inspire us to:

Think creatively by leveraging innovative approaches

Critically rethink the way we approach the development challenges of today

Raise actionable & achievable advocacy and awareness efforts for the goals

Mobilize crucial support for the Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development

Enhance substantive knowledge about the 2030 Agenda and the Sustainable Development Goals

The Sustainable Development Goals together represent a holistic approach to understanding and tackling problems in our community and around the world, by guiding us to ask the right questions at the right time.
